content.description: The typical face climb in the McDowell's with thin edges and a few crusty flakes.
content.protection: 2 bolts.  Walk off to the west.
content.location: The first bolted face climb that is just left of the Boston Bee Strangler route.

content.description: Short crack with a couple of climbing moves to get to the top.
content.protection: Single rack to BD #3. A single bolt above Logan’s Run can be used to rap down or belay someone up from.
content.location: Upper Granite Ballroom. Obvious crack right of  Logan’s Run.

content.description: Southeast-facing bulging slab, split by two assuaging horizontal seams below the first clip.
content.protection: Three draws. Four bolts. Active beehive forty five feet up and left (SW) of route.
content.location: Upper Granite Ballroom above Uneventful, Boston Bee Strangler and Delusions of Grandeur. Left of easy trad route, Piano Man.

content.description: A thin crack with a few surprisingly good jams and nice feet will keep a climber happy.  Sort of hard near the end of the crack and before climbing the face above.  Two bolts protect the face climbing moves to the summit.
content.protection: Small cams to #1, two bolts.  Rap anchor at top.
content.location: Around the north-east side of the formation off a nice boulder hides this gem.  Walk around to the right of Boston Bee Strangler or scramble through the Ballroom to reach the route.

content.description:
A hardy thrutch that will make you consider if you really can climb 5.8.  Fist jam and funky wide fun leads to nice jams up higher.  For comparison, it feels a bit like Y-Crack and for a moment like Hades over at Pinnacle Peak.

 There currently is no beehive on the route or signs of recent activity but in the old guidebook it mentions a hive somewhere on route.
content.protection: Cams to #5.  Walk off to the east.
content.location: The obvious wide, left leaning crack at the bottom of the formation.  Immediately to the left is the two bolted face route Uneventful.

content.description: A nice winter retreat or late summer afternoon escape.  Easy to access with several routes that should satisfy the face climber, crack climber and even the odd chimney lovers.  A double rack and several draws will be more than enough for this collection of climbs
